Title.evidence: Methods.: This was a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase 2 trial of patients undergoing renal transplantation

Trial_Design.evidence: Subjects were randomized as 2:1 to 3, once-daily IV infusions of ANG-3777, 2 mg/kg (n = 19), or placebo (n = 9).

Participants.evidence: patients undergoing renal transplantation with <50 cc/h urine output for 8 consecutive hours over the first 24 hours posttransplantation, or creatinine reduction ratio <30% from pretransplantation to 24 hours posttransplantation.

Intervention.evidence: Subjects were randomized as 2:1 to 3, once-daily IV infusions of ANG-3777, 2 mg/kg (n = 19), or placebo (n = 9).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary endpoint: time in days to achieve ≥1200 cc urine for 24 hours.

Blinding.evidence: This was a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, phase 2 trial

Number_Randomised.evidence: Subjects were randomized as 2:1 to 3, once-daily IV infusions of ANG-3777, 2 mg/kg (n = 19), or placebo (n = 9).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients treated with ANG-3777 were more likely to achieve the primary endpoint of 1200 cc urine for 24 hours by 28 days posttransplantation (83.3% versus 50% placebo; log-rank test: χ 2 = 2.799, P = 0.09).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events occurred in a similar percentage of subjects in both arms.
